ai.summary: Nore Hill Folly walk is a 12.5 km moderate circuit around Slindon, in the South East of England. The route blends woodland tracks, chalk downland paths, and quiet country lanes, finishing with a view from the Nore Hill Folly over the surrounding countryside. Expect gentle ascents, uneven surfaces, and opportunities to spot wildlife and birds along the way. A solid mid-length day out suitable for walkers with reasonable fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain is a mix of well-trodden farmland paths, chalk tracks across downs, and woodland trails. Surfaces range from compact dirt to muddy single-track in wetter seasons; there are a few stiles and gentle gradients. Footing can be uneven underfoot in woodland sections; waterproof footwear is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for UK weather; the open downs can be exposed and windy. Wear sturdy boots, bring a waterproof layer and extra warm layer. Carry a map or GPS and know how to navigate; in parts of the route cell service may be patchy. Take sufficient water and snacks; mind gates and livestock in fields, and close gates behind you. Watch for uneven ground and steps on stiles. Shorter daylight in winter; start early or carry a torch if finishing after dusk. Tell someone your planned route and expected return.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device

seo.title: Nore Hill Folly Walk, Slindon – 12.5 km Moderate Circuit in West Sussex, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Nore Hill Folly walk near Slindon. A 12.5 km moderate circuit through woodland and downs with views, practical safety tips, and packing suggestions for a UK day hike.
